summary: Initialize a Lightweight Temporal Self-Attention Encoder (LTAE) model
description: Creates and configures a Lightweight Temporal Self-Attention Encoder (LTAE) model. LTAE is designed for efficient modeling of temporal dependencies in sequential data using self-attention mechanisms. Parameters such as optimizer, learning rate, and learning rate decay schedule can be specified.

parameters.name: epochs
parameters.description: The number of training epochs. Defaults to 150.

parameters.name: batch_size
parameters.description: The size of batches for training. Defaults to 128.

parameters.name: optimizer
parameters.description: The optimizer to use for training. Defaults to 'adam'. Supported values include 'adam', 'adabound', 'adabelief', 'madagrad', 'nadam', 'qhadam', 'radam', 'swats', and 'yogi'.

parameters.name: learning_rate
parameters.description: The initial learning rate for training. Defaults to 0.0005.

parameters.name: epsilon
parameters.description: The epsilon value for numerical stability in optimizers. Defaults to 1e-8.

parameters.name: weight_decay
parameters.description: The weight decay (L2 penalty) value for regularization. Defaults to 0.0007.

parameters.name: lr_decay_epochs
parameters.description: The number of epochs after which the learning rate is decayed. Defaults to 50.

parameters.name: lr_decay_rate
parameters.description: The rate at which the learning rate is decayed after the specified number of epochs. Defaults to 1.

parameters.name: random_state
parameters.description: A randomization seed to use for the random sampling in training. If not given or `null`, no seed is used and results may differ on subsequent use.

returns.description: An untrained Lightweight Temporal Self-Attention Encoder (LTAE) model instance.

links.description: Research paper describing the Lightweight Temporal Self-Attention Encoder (LTAE).
links.citation: V. S. F. Garnot and L. Landrieu, “Lightweight Temporal Self-attention for Classifying Satellite Images Time Series,” in Advanced Analytics and Learning on Temporal Data, 2020, pp. 171–181, doi: 10.1007/978-3-030-65742-0_12.
